summary: Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, is the world's coldest capital. With a population of 1.6 million, it's where almost half of Mongolians live. Founded in 1639 as a Buddhist center, it became the country's capital in 1924. The city has a mix of old and new, with traditional ger districts and modern Soviet-style flats. It played a key role in Mongolia's independence and transition to democracy. Ulaanbaatar is surrounded by TÃ¶v Province and is the nation's cultural, industrial, and financial hub.
title: Ulaanbaatar
